intro: Bakerella belohensis, commonly known as the Bornean starflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has woody stems with dense foliage. Its flowers, which bloom in clusters, are often white or pale pink, and it produces small, leathery fruits. Bakerella belohensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to the tropical rainforest ecosystem.
